newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Tyumen official wants oil firm state-owned.
newsitem.headline: Russian Tyumen official wants oil firm state-owned.

text.p: The governor of Russia's oil-rich Tyumen region called on Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin on Thursday to halt privatisation of the Tyumen Oil Company.
"TNK should be preserved as it is and not turned into private property," Leonid Roketsky told a goverment meeting.
TNK, whose board chairman is former Fuel and Energy Minister Yuri Shafranik, is one of Russia's few remaining oil companies that is nearly 100 percent state-owned.
Russia has privatised most of its oil sector by turning former production associations into vertically-integrated or independent companies, and the sell-off is continuing.
TNK produced 21.30 million tonnes of crude oil in 1996, compared to 22.57 million tonnes in 1995.
Its main production units are Nizhnevartovskneftegaz and Tyumenneftegaz.
